Detailed Description

The action bar is at the top of the page and it can shows a title, a subtitle, the 'up' and a custom widget.

By Default, the action bar shows the page title.

From your page, you can retrieve an instance of ActionBar by calling getActionBar().

The following example demonstrates how to use the ActionBar

 ActionBar* mpActionBar = getActionBar();

 mpActionBar->setTitle("Hello");

Definition at line 45 of file ActionBar.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::core::ActionBar::AnimationType
Enumerator:
ANIMATION_NONE 

No animation when show the action bar.

ANIMATION_UP_DOWN 

Animation is from up to down when show the action bar.

ANIMATION_DOWN_UP 

Animation is from down to up when show the action bar.

Reimplemented in gaia::core::HTCActionBar.

Definition at line 237 of file ActionBar.h.

enum gaia::core::ActionBar::Display
Enumerator:
DISPLAY_SHOW_HOME 

Show 'home' elements in this action bar.

DISPLAY_HOME_AS_UP 

Show the 'up' element in the action bar.

You must also use DISPLAY_SHOW_TITLE or DISPLAY_SHOW_HOME_AS_UP, or it can't see 'up' element.

DISPLAY_SHOW_HOME_AS_UP 

The conjunction of DISPLAY_SHOW_HOME and DISPLAY_HOME_AS_UP.

DISPLAY_SHOW_TITLE 

Show the page title and subtitle, if present.

DISPLAY_SHOW_CUSTOM 

Show the custom widget if one has been set.

Definition at line 47 of file ActionBar.h.
